Package javelin.model.unit.abilities.discipline

Class Discipline

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.unit.abilities.discipline.Discipline
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CombatExpertiseDiscipline, SteelSerpent
    public abstract class Discipline
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represent a martial-arts discipline from the Path of War books, which is basically a collection of Maneuvers. Each discipline should have at least 2 Maneuvers per level. Technically, everything is fine as long as there at least 2 disciplines per leve of MartialTraining the unit can upgrade to - so having 8 level 1 Maneuvers is enough to get a discipline to level 4 (even if not ideal).
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Disciplines.ALL, Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • DISCIPLINES

        public static final Discipline[] DISCIPLINES

      • hasacademy

        public boolean hasacademy
        Whether FeatureGenerator should generate a DisciplineAcademy or not. Useful for emulating abilities that are not Maneuvers as disciplines for the sake of using the existing ExecuteManeuver integrated user interface. Note that some disciplines (such as CombatExpertise) have an Academy - but they are not actual instances of DisciplineAcademy and are generateed in some other way. In these cases, hasacademy would always be false.
        See Also:
        FeatureGenerator, generateacademy()

      • name

        public java.lang.String name

      • classupgrade

        public final ClassLevelUpgrade classupgrade
        This is supposed to always be Warrior due to balancing reasons.

      • buildacademy

      • getmaneuvers

        protected abstract Maneuver[] getmaneuvers()
        Returns:
        A static, non-serializable list of Maneuvers that are part of this martial path. This is to reduce the number of bugs, prevent duplication of these lists when each new instance of the game is opened and to make debug easier without losing game state.

      • getmaneuvers

        public Maneuvers getmaneuvers​(java.lang.Integer maxlevel)
        Parameters:
        maxlevel - Any Maneuver higher than this level will not be returned. If null, return all Maneuvers.
        Returns:
        A new list with the filtered maneuvers from this discipline.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getupgrades

        public Upgrade[] getupgrades()
        Returns:
        All of the upgrades that are part of the discipline, in the order they should be applied to get the most out of training under it.
